description: Airstrike in Myanmar's Rakhine state killed at least 19 high school students. Twenty-two others sustained injuries. The Arakan Army reported the incident occurred in Kyauktaw township. The AA blamed the ruling military junta for the attack on private schools. UNICEF condemned the brutal attack. The strike adds to escalating violence in Rakhine.

description: Oracle's stock surged by 36% following multi-billion-dollar AI cloud deals, briefly making Larry Ellison the world's richest person. This rally minted hundreds of new millionaires among Oracle staff, thanks to restricted stock units. An engineer in Bengaluru now values his portfolio at Rs 1.5 crore.

description: A Pakistani Taliban ambush in South Waziristan resulted in the deaths of at least 12 soldiers, marking one of the deadliest attacks in recent months. The Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) claimed responsibility, highlighting the intensified militant activities in the Afghanistan-Pakistan border regions since 2021.

description: Gunshots were fired at actress Disha Patani's family home in Bareilly, with her father, Jagdish Patani, confirming the use of foreign-made weapons. The Goldy Brar group claimed responsibility, citing alleged disrespect towards religious figures. Police have launched an investigation, registered an FIR, and increased security for the Patani family, with multiple teams working to apprehend the assailants.

description: A woman testing a Mahindra Thar in a Delhi showroom accidentally accelerated, crashing through a glass wall and plunging 15 feet. Despite the dramatic accident, the woman, her husband, and a showroom employee escaped with only minor injuries. The woman has since refuted rumors of serious injury or death, attributing the incident to high RPM.

description: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files' is embroiled in controversy after YouTuber Dhruv Rathee criticized the filmmaker for allegedly showing the adult-rated film to children. Rathee expressed concern over the potential trauma caused by the film's violence and gore. The film, part of Agnihotri's 'files' trilogy, explores the events surrounding Direct Action Day in 1946 and has garnered mixed reviews.

description: Hyderabad police have apprehended Harsh and Roushan in Ranchi for the brutal murder of 50-year-old Renuka Agarwal at her Kukatpally flat. The attackers, who repeatedly assaulted Agarwal with a pressure cooker and stabbed her, sought access to valuables. After the murder, they stole gold and cash, changed clothes, and fled, but were traced via CCTV footage and a manpower agent.

Affected employees, generalist AI tutors, were notified via email and had their system access terminated immediately.

description: In a 12-year-old case, AAP MLA Manjinder Singh Lalpura from Khadoor Sahib has been sentenced to four years in prison for assault and molestation of a Dalit woman. An additional sessions judge convicted eleven individuals, including six policemen. Lalpura and six others received four-year terms, while three got one-year sentences.

The attack is suspected to be connected to a controversy involving Disha's sister, Khushboo Patani, who criticized Aniruddh Acharya for alleged misogynistic remarks. Khushboo's online video expressing her anger may have triggered the incident.

Pune techie attacked with billhook outside Vimannagar; accused arrested
description: In Pune, a 33-year-old IT professional was brutally attacked with a billhook outside his fiancée's workplace in Vimannagar. Two men, later arrested, assaulted him due to mistaken identity, fueled by a cab driver's suspicion of a love affair. The victim sustained severe injuries, prompting calls for increased security and patrolling in the area, highlighting rising concerns about criminal activities.

title: ‘Demanded job again’: Fired worker kills Hyderabad bizman in full public view; manhunt on
description: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: ‘Burnt alive over dowry’: Victim’s last words convict in-laws; UP court gives them life term
description: An Aligarh court sentenced five family members to life imprisonment for the dowry death of Neelam Bharti, who was harassed for more dowry even after her family spent Rs 20 lakh on the wedding. Before dying from being set ablaze, Neelam identified her husband, in-laws, and sister-in-law as her murderers in a dying declaration.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
description: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: Engagement buzz to fan backlash; Gaylor community divided
description: Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce has stirred a whirlwind of reactions, particularly among the 'Gaylor' fanbase, who believe Swift's public image conceals her true identity. Kelce's role has become central to discussions, with some fans questioning the authenticity of the relationship. While some express disappointment, others adopt a more nuanced perspective, acknowledging the complexities of identity and relationships.
